title: How to Select All Contacts on iPhone

steps.title: Install Groups from the App Store .
steps.content: Install Groups from the App Store . Groups is a free app that allows you to select and delete multiple contacts at the same time. Tap the search icon that looks like a magnifying glass at the bottom of your screen, then search "Groups". Select the search result for Groups offered by Qbix, Inc, which is next to a yellow, blue, green, and red icon with a web symbol inside it. Tap Get to download and install the app.

steps.title: Open Groups.
steps.content: Open Groups. This app icon looks like a yellow, blue, green, and red icon with a web symbol inside it. You can find it on one of your Home screens or by searching. Alternatively, tap Open/Launch from the App Store if you still have that window open.

steps.title: Tap Let’s Get Started.
steps.content: Tap Let’s Get Started . It’s at the bottom of the screen. If it’s your first time using the app, you’ll have to provide access to your contacts by tapping OK .

steps.title: Tap All Contacts.
steps.content: Tap All Contacts . You'll see this at the top of the screen. A list of all of your contacts will appear.

steps.title: Tap the contacts you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap the contacts you want to delete. A checkmark will appear to the left of each selected name.

steps.title: Tap Choose Action.
steps.content: Tap Choose Action . This is at the top of your screen where you tapped All Contacts and will prompt a pop-up menu to appear.

steps.title: Tap Delete Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Delete Contacts . It’s the next-to-last option. Alternatively, you can select to remove any duplicate contact information, add the selected contacts to a group, email the contact info, or add a reminder to that contact's information.

steps.title: Tap Remove from my iPhone.
steps.content: Tap Remove from my iPhone . The contacts are no longer on your iPhone and you can look through your default Contacts app to verify.

steps.title: Go to http://www.icloud.com/ and log in.
steps.content: Go to http://www.icloud.com/ and log in. You'll need to do this on a Mac since you need to access the web version of the site, not the mobile version.

steps.title: Click Contacts.
steps.content: Click Contacts . This icon looks like the profiles of different people on an address book.

steps.title: Press and hold Ctrl and select the contacts you want to delete.
steps.content: Press and hold Ctrl and select the contacts you want to delete. As long as you hold down the Ctrl key, you can select multiple contacts. Selected contacts will highlight in blue so you'll know who you've clicked. Ctrl + click a selected contact to de-select them.

steps.title: Press Delete on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press Delete on your keyboard. The Delete key is on the right side of a Mac's keyboard and will prompt iCloud to delete your selection.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . A window will pop-up to confirm that you want to delete the selected contacts; click Delete and they will be deleted from your iCloud and your iPhone. [2] X Research source
